com.github.mathiewz.slick

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mathiewz.slick.Color
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Color
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A simple wrapper round the values required for a colour
    Author:
    Kevin Glass
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        b - The blue component of the colour (0.0 to 1.0)

      • Color

        public Color(int r,
             int g,
             int b)
        Create a 3 component colour
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the colour (0 to 255)
        g - The green component of the colour (0 to 255)
        b - The blue component of the colour (0 to 255)

      • Color

        public Color(int r,
             int g,
             int b,
             int a)
        Create a 4 component colour
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the colour (0 to 255)
        g - The green component of the colour (0 to 255)
        b - The blue component of the colour (0 to 255)
        a - The alpha component of the colour (0 to 255)

      • Color

        public Color(int value)
        Create a colour from an evil integer packed 0xAARRGGBB. If AA is specified as zero then it will be interpreted as unspecified and hence a value of 255 will be recorded.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to interpret for the colour

      • darker

        public Color darker(float scale)
        Make a darker instance of this colour
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale down of RGB (i.e. if you supply 0.03 the colour will be darkened by 3%)
        Returns:
        The darker version of this colour
